europeana:record.dc:title: A field guide to the Silurian Echinodermata of the British Isles: Part 1 - Eleutherozoa and Rhombifera
Scripta Geologica
europeana:record.dc:creator: Lewis D.N.
Donovan S.K.
Crabb P.
Gladwell D.J.
europeana:record.dc:subject: Echinoderms
Silurian
British Isles
echinoids
asteroids
ophiuroids
cystoids
ophiocystitoids
europeana:record.dc:description: The Palaeozoic echinoderms of the British Isles are most diverse in the Silurian and Lower Carboniferous. This guide discusses and illustrates members of all major groups of echinoderms, apart from the crinoids, from the Silurian of these islands. Groups considered include the echinoids (five taxa), ophiuroids (ten taxa) and asteroids (thirteen taxa), and the extinct ophiocistioids (three species) and rhombiferan cystoids (nine species).
europeana:record.dcterms:isPartOf: A field guide to the Silurian Echinodermata of the British Isles: Part 1 - Eleutherozoa and Rhombifera (URN:ISSN:03757587) (Volume 134)
